text: Edward W. Furia, Project Director of the 1970 Earth Week Committee of Philadelphia. Edward W. Furia was Project Director of the Earth Week Committee of Philadelphia during the first Earth Day in 1970.The New York Times - The Business of Earth Day ==Earth Week== The Committee was made up of 33 students, professionals, leaders of grass roots organizations and businessmen who were concerned about the environment.1970 Earth Week Committee of Philadelphia - Official Website Their common goal was to raise public awareness of environmental issues and their possible solutions.1970 Earth Week Committee of Philadelphia - Official Website The group expanded in 1970 to include students from other colleges in the area, as well as from other business, community, and church groups which, together, organized numerous educational activities, scientific symposia and major press events in and around Philadelphia.1970 Earth Week Committee of Philadelphia - Official Website ==Biography== Following Earth Week, Edward Furia served as regional administrator of the Middle Atlantic Region of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency,The New York Times - The Business of Earth Day during which he brought about the first Clean Air Act case, against Getty Oil Company, which survived a supreme court test in 1972.1970 Earth Week Committee of Philadelphia - Official Website In 1990, to commemorate the 20th anniversary of Earth Day, Furia assembled The Earth Day 20 Foundation, a group for which Senator Gaylord Nelson (the original founder of Earth Day) was honorary chairman.The New York Times - The Business of Earth Day Furia highlighted the Earth Day 20 activities on April 22 in George, Washington with two live satellite phone calls.https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=4oJvMfeQlr8C&dat;=19900423&printsec;=frontpage The first call was with members of the historic Earth Day 20 International Peace Climb (it was the first time in history that mountaineers from the United States, Soviet Union and China had roped together to climb a mountain), who called from their base camp on Mount Everest to pledge their support for world peace and attention to environmental issues.https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=4oJvMfeQlr8C&dat;=19900423&printsec;=frontpage The second call was with President George H.W. Bush, who spoke directly to Furia and the assembled crowd about his support the Earth Day.George Bush: Remarks to Participants in the Columbia River Gorge Earth Day 20 Rally Months earlier, Furia visited The White House to witness Bush's signing ceremony for the 20th Earth Day Proclamation, declaring Earth Day a national holiday for the first time.https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=4oJvMfeQlr8C&dat;=19900423&printsec;=frontpage Since 1990, Furia has been CEO of AFS Trinity (previously American Flywheel Systems),AFS Trinity Power - Official Website a company that has developed a plug-in hybrid electric vehicle called “The Extreme Hybrid”The New York Times - Closing the Power Gap Between a Hybrid’s Supply and Demand that has been test-driven by journalists from The New York Times,http://greeninc.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/04/20/sprinting-for-green- stimulus-dollars/ The Washington Post,https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp- dyn/content/article/2009/06/12/AR2009061202128.html?sub=AR ABC World News,https://abcnews.go.com/Business/story?id=4991666&page;=2 CBS Evening News,https://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2008/01/12/eveningnews/main3704867.shtml CNN,http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/tech/2008/01/11/hunter.extreme.hybrid.cnn?iref=videosearch and Salon.http://www.salon.com/news/feature/2008/01/22/plug_in_hybrids ==References== Category:Living people Category:American activists Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
